fields.description:
When a user indexes in 1.6.* the indexes can grow to quite a 3-5x bigger than the indexes in 1.5*. 

Also the indexes are much larger the entire size of the repository. For example a 17G svn repo can have an index that is 40G+ in size. 

# Add a config option to turn off storing content in the index
# Document features affected by disabling 
# Document at least an indicative index size with this option on/off
fields.summary: Fisheye Indexes are much bigger in 1.6.x

FE-942 View an activity stream of commits on the changelog page, i.e. constrained by repo/dir.
fields.summary: Performance testing the Activity Stream

fields.description:
Generated from [https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-1549]

In fisheye you may define many different repositories that all point to the same svn server. 

Your SVN server using svn serve with xinetd may have a limit, e.g. 5 connections to IP. Fisheye tries to open many connections (as it has many repositories pointing to the same server ) and xinetd denies over 5 connections, causing 

{noformat}
Unable to initialise repository svn://HOST/REPO/ due to com.cenqua.fisheye.config.ConfigException:Unable to get repository information: org.tigris.subversion.javahl.ClientException: svn: connection refused by the server
or
Unable to initialise repository svn://HOST/REPO/ due to com.cenqua.fisheye.config.ConfigException:Unable to get repository information: org.tigris.subversion.javahl.ClientException: svn: Handshake failed, received:
{noformat}

errors. 

The workaround is to go to Administration > Server Settings > Resource Limits and set it to one Initial indexing thread and one Incremental indexing thread. 
Next go into Administration > Repository List > View (next to your svn repo) > Edit details and set the throttle connections per sec to blank, i.e. do not throttle or at most  2 if your xinetd  limit is set to 5 (as index thread + incremental thread = 4 connections).
fields.summary: Limit the number of concurrent connections from fisheye to one SVN server

fields.description: The "Save" button does not have a name attribute, making it close to impossible to create a review with customised title and description in automated functional testing using jWebUnit, which can only submit a form by "clicking" a named button.
fields.summary: Name that "Save" button in the Crucible review edit page.
Include activity of the users starred items on the user page

fields.description:
Generated from [https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-1541]. 

Fisheye when running checks a branch update time and stores this, then the next time it checks the branch update time it compares to this value. 

However this value is only stored in memory and not in the db, thus upon a restart of the server, each branch needs to be scanned for updates which can be costly in certain environments (large number of branches). 

It would be better if we can store this in the fisheye db, along with other data (such as last notification to be sent, etc.
fields.summary: Fisheye does not store the update time of p4 branches in the db, which means that upon a restart each branch is scanned for updates despite the fact it is not updated
If the star label dialog is made modal, then links stop working after it is closed

fields.description: It appears that FishEye might not be picking up changes to the check-in comments AFTER the initial check-in. If the JIRA issue Key is added in the comment after the file was checked in subversion, FishEye won't pick up the file and match it to the JIRA issue.
fields.summary: FishEye might not be picking up changes to the check-in comments AFTER the initial check-in

fields.description:
We have some file that was added to repository. Fisheye (and crucible) represents just first 10 lines of it, however real file contains 74 lines. Raw view of file represents it correctly (file representation and contents of raw file view attached)

I susggest that this problems could be caused by win-1251 symbols in the file. We use svn repository. And Fisheye configured to see repository in windows-1251 encoding.

Repository configuration:

Name:	iikoRMS
Description:	
SVN URL:	http://devserver:81/svn/resto
SVN Path:	
Blocksize:	(default)
Svn Operation Timeout:	
Throttle connections-per-sec:	(not throttled)
Charset:	 windows-1251
Access Code    :	 none
Start Revision    :	 15000
Initial Import:	 Do not Import
Store Diff Info:	true
fields.summary: Fisheye (and crucible) represents just first 10 lines of 74 lines file

fields.summary: title attribute of revision links should containing the commit message for that revision in annotated view

fields.description: We would like the ability to create search queries via UI functions in diffs.  We want to find similar matching code to a particular diff section or entire diff between 2 revisions.
fields.summary: Create search queries from diffs or diff sections

fields.description:
There are instances when the index appears to hang and there isn't much information via the UI for administrations to debug. 

Currently, they need to go to Administration > Server Settings > Debug Logging and Turn Debug Logging "ON" and then check their debug logs to see what command fisheye last sent, to see whether that could be a problem. 

for example 

"Executing p4 -p perforce:1666 -u p4admin login"

It would be great if they can see this within the Administration panel, so that when it appears stuck, then can run the same command on the command line to ensure that connectivity is working, and what in the results can be holding up the index. It also will help speed up the resolution of support issues, as users can provide more information without having to first turn debugging on.
fields.summary: View which SCM commands fisheye is running via the Administration

fields.description:
If we try to cancel an svn operation and the svn server fails to respond, the index thread can get locked up. 

An option we have would be to restructure FishEye slightly so that svn operations do not occur on the main thread but an ancilary thread so we can regain control of the main thread if need be.

Workarounds are listed in this [knowledge base article|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHKB/Getting+repeated+Interrupting+SVN+operation+thread+due+to+non-response+WARNs+in+logs+until+restart].
fields.summary: Restructure FishEye so that svn operations do not occur on the main thread

fields.description:
To make the FishEye Coverage build run on an arbitrary agent, update the FishEye/Crucible build process to store the Historypoints to SVN. 
This should be done in a separate target which is only called from Bamboo to prevent developers accidently checking their own history data to svn.
fields.summary: Store cover historypoints in SVN
Refactor db model to allow key components

fields.description:
When you have "Force Lowercase Username" option on, it will change all usernames to lowercase when you log in. 

However in the Test Authentication step, after creating an LDAP or Custom Authenticator, the username is not set to lowercase when the option is on. 

I believe the test authentication code was present before the "Force Lowercase Username" option was present, and was not considered when this option was introduced. 

It can be confusing for writers of custom authentication, as the test authentication and actual authentication perform differently.
fields.summary: Custom or LDAP Authentication Test, ignores the Force Lowercase username option

fields.summary: Not all the repositories show in the Constraint branch drop down list

We should check for the trailing "/" and if not present, add it ourselves.
fields.summary: Crowd authentication throws a 404 error if you do not include the trailing "/" when specifying the Crowd URL

fields.description:
*joe* : I've found that you could star a review that doesnt exist - and it turns up empty in the my stars tab : http://img.skitch.com/20090116-j8fwh854uykjn13jfqiegs8r3p.png 

A potential problem? It only happened accidentally because I did a clean, and then clicked on a cached page.

-----
*matt*: yes that is a problem, it needs to be a valid review *you can see* 

- check review existance and premisison at creation 
- check review existance and permission at view -- if it doesn't exist delete the star, or say "review was removed" ? 

Same existance/permission check needs to be done for all types, including repositories. Maybe make a "validToAddStar()" check on Star or StarFactory ?
fields.summary: add permission check when starring a review
make age more verby too
show implicit display name of the user if unmapped/available
Warn me if I attempt to override an existing mapping, allow me to override

fields.description:
When a customer has LDAP/Crowd which has usernames in camel case. 

However the customer would like to allow all users to log in via lower case username. 

Thus turn "Force Lowercase Username option" on and sync with LDAP/crowd, however the sync process does not take into account this option, thus all users will be imported as they are rather than as lower case user names. 

Thus users will not be able to log in, as the lowercase username does not match any users.
fields.summary: Sync with LDAP/Crowd does not take into account "Force Lowercase Username option"
add basic admin rights actions to edit/delete/add mappings

fields.description: FE periodically checks for new versions (implemented as part of FE-428). We should refactor that as a Quartz job.
fields.summary: Refactor software update poller to Quartz
Write an integration test
Korean version of windows OS, does not have monospace font-family type.

fields.description:
When a user updates their svn commits (for example to add a JIRA issue code that they forgot to include the first time), then go into fisheye and trigger a rescan revision properties for the appropriate revision change, then fisheye updates the commit message as expected. 

However searching for the JIRA issue code that you have added to the commit, does not return that commit, as the rescan revision properties does not update the search index with the new commit message.
fields.summary: Search Index is not updated after a rescan of properties

fields.description:
If the wrapped request has parameters added after the setParameter(String, String) of WrappedRequest has been invoked, the getParameter(String) method cannot return the the latest parameter added to the original wrapped request.
The bug holds for getParameterMap(), getParameterNames() and getParameterValues(String) as well.

The scenario when additional parameters can be added to the original request after the setParameter(String, String) of WrappedRequest has been invoked is:
When rendering a JSP page, jsp:include can pass additional parameters to the request object. These parameters are added to the original request object by the servlet container, bypassing the interception of WrappedRequst.
fields.summary: WrappedRequest does not delegate to super for all get* methods when the private params map is not null
Investigate moving cancelEvent and return into body of removeStar and addStar

fields.description:
Allow a user to search through multiple projects or repositories

Example:

select revisions FROM my_repository, my_repository2 WHERE author = "edwardscoder"

The search should not default to instance wide imho, for performance reasons.

This would teams with multiple repositories or projects easier access to discovering gaps or other issues.
fields.summary: Ability to create eyeQL searches across multiple repositories / projects

fields.description:
This query has a parse error:

select revisions from dir / where author = "mryall" group by changeset order by date

This query doesn't:

select revisions from dir / where author = "mryall" order by date group by changeset 

Notes:

1. Matt Q says the ordering of ORDER BY and GROUP BY shouldn't be significant in EyeQL.
2. The order of the clauses in SQL has the GROUP BY first, so EyeQL should support queries in that format.
fields.summary: Ordering of "ORDER BY" and "GROUP BY" clauses in EyeQL is significant and shouldn't be

fields.description:
I was showing Matt how I'd get 500's from the breadcrumb File Search input. He told me it was for files, not the directory I was looking for, and suggested I search for build.xml
I searched.
It returned a 500.
fields.summary: File Search 500's

fields.description:
We defined a lot of fisheye-projects refering all the same svn-server (with different repositories and different users for those repos). Unfortunatly fisheye is using the first defined repos-user of the first defined project for all other projects - it doesn't care about the real configuration. Due to this we had to change our svn-permission-model which should not be a solution for this problem.

The way we found out that problem was to "listen" at the svn-access-log-file.

We had this problem with version 1.6.3 tried a full reconfiguration with version 1.6.4 and had the same problem.
fields.summary: svn-connection getting wrong values out of the repository configuration
get data and render
